learning_outcomes.description: Be able to plan, develop and carry out an independent research project.
Obtain in-depth knowledge of the specific topic area through a thorough literature review.
Develop research skills and be able to locate and use information sources.
Present results of research in a written thesis.
Present results of research in an oral seminar

assessments.task_description: At the midpoint of their project, students must submit a written literature review and progress report, indicating the progress they have made on their thesis, the material they have consulted, and their plans for the remainder of the semester. The same week, the student will arrange a time with their supervisor(s) + second grader to present and discuss the progress of the project.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The literature review and progress report is to be submitted electronically to the supervisor(s), second reader, and honours coordinator.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: Towards the end of the second semester, students will give a public 20-minute talk on their honours project.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: At the end of their semester of work, each student submits their honours thesis, the final written report of around 20,000-30,000 words in length.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The thesis is to be submitted electronically to the supervisor(s), second reader, honours coordinator, and the school office.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
During the examination period of the semester, each student shall attend an oral examination with two assessors (supervisor and examiner) who have read the report and attended the seminar.

After the oral defence and discussion, the assessors will submit their percentage marks conforming to the standard guidelines for grades of honours.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.
